channel.title: Segment Routing Documentation
channel.description: Documentation, Blogs and Tutorials for all things Segment Routing

item.title: Segment Routing Introduction
item.dc:creator: Segment Routing Team
item.description: An introduction to Segment Routing and its concepts.

item.title: Segment Routing MPLS data plane
item.dc:creator: Segment Routing Team
item.description: See how segment routing leverages the existing MPLS data plane and learn how to verify segment routing MPLS forwarding.

item.title: Segment Routing Global Block (SRGB)
item.dc:creator: Segment Routing Team
item.description: See what the Segment Routing Global Block is. Learn about the best practices to use the same SRGB on all segment routing nodes. Further, learn how to modify the Segment Routing Global Block.

item.title: Segment Routing IGP Control plane
item.dc:creator: Segment Routing Team
item.description: Learn how to use IS-IS or OSPF to distribute segments, how to configure segment routing and how segment routing works in a multi-area or multi-level network. Further, learn how to verify segment routing advertisements.

item.title: Segment Routing and LDP co-existence
item.dc:creator: Segment Routing Team
item.description: See how segment routing can co-exist with LDP and other MPLS protocols, both on the control plane and on the data plane. Further learn how to affect a simple migration from LDP to segment routing.

item.title: Segment Routing Mapping server
item.dc:creator: Segment Routing Team
item.description: Learn about the objective of the Mapping Server and see how one may configure it. Further, verify the mapping server functionality.

item.title: Segment Routing and LDP interworking
item.dc:creator: Segment Routing Team
item.description: Learn about the simple, automatic and seamless interworking between segment routing and LDP. See what the role of the Mapping Server is in the interworking functionality and learn about the interworking functionality on the data plane. Further verify the interworking forwarding entries.

item.title: Topology Independent LFA (TI-LFA)
item.dc:creator: Segment Routing Team
item.description: An introduction to the Topology Independent LFA technology.See how Topology Independent LFA provides a simple, automatic, optimal and topology independent sub-50ms per-prefix protection to the network. Further, see how TI-LFA protects Segment Routing, LDP and eventually IP traffic. In the end, learn how to verify TI-LFA using some examples
